result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber N Biamonte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amber N Biamonte is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amber N Biamonte was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to see mental health provider as scheduled/determined by the provider. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis, at least one time per month.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber N Biamonte

defendant.name: Biamonte, Amber N
defendant.address: 310 S Cherry Street, La Farge, WI 54639

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Dismissal for Count-2 and Count-3
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:56 PM Case called - appearances stated. cases 21CF109 & 22CF23 both called

Defendant Amber N Biamonte in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Amber N Biamonte.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions def. re: plea agreement
def. states understanding - will plead to Ct. 1 in each case and the remaining cts. will be dismissed

Court reviews plea questionnaire with defendant as to both cases
def. states understanding
Def. enters plea of no contest to Ct.1 in both cases 21CF109 & 22CF23
Court accepts def's plea of no contest, finds def. guilty

Atty. Steiner moves to dismiss cts 2,3 & 4 in 21CF109, and cts. 2 & 3 in 22CF23
Court dismisses counts 2,3 & 4 in 21CF109 and cts 2 & 3 in 22CF23

Atty. Steiner is heard on sentence - recommends sentence be withheld, probation 3 yrs - conditions of probation deemed appropriate by DOC, 21CF109 condition serve 30 days jail. Jail credit as determined by Atty. Richards is correct. 
questions by Court -response by Atty. Steiner

Atty Richards is heard on sentence - 57 days credit in 21CF109, 20 days credit on 22CF23, requests court follow agreement of parties
Comments by Defendant

Court is heard on sentence - withholds sentence on both cases, 3 years probation on both cases- conditions of probation include AODA assessment, see mental health provider as scheduled/determined by the provider, random UA's, but at least one time per month. no conditional jail imposed in light of fact that 57 days served in 21CF109, and 20 days served 22CF23- credit of those days in event def. is revoked. Court costs to be paid $25/mo com. 6/1/22.
bond to be applied.  Both cases to be combined in one payment plan. defaults stated.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Atty Richards requests a breakout room. 10:33 AM.
Resume 10:40 AM.
